intro: Launaea taraxacifolia, commonly known as the dandelion leaf cholla, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant has a rosette growth pattern, with leaves arranged in a spiral around the central stem. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by small, wind-dispersed seeds. Launaea taraxacifolia is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
